DOC.HEAD: Events in Panama
Eds: LEADS thruout to UPDATE with report of Noriega asking for political asylum. No pickup.
With AM-Panama, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Here is a brief summary of events Sunday: _Gen. Maxwell Thurman, chief of the U.S. Southern Command, said he had a report that ousted dictator Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega turned himself in to the papal representative in Panama and asked for political asylum. _Earlier, four of Noriega's top commanders surrendered to U.S. soldiers. _Fighting tapered off, with some Panamanians trying to clean up streets and put up Christmas decorations. _The U.S.-backed president, Guillermo Endara, said he hoped the Americans would be able to leave soon, but that he wasn't optimistic. _U.S. troops discovered a huge cache of arms in a rented house near Noriega's family home in an upper-middle class section of Panama City. Neighbors who tipped off the military said the house had been rented by Noriega. _In Washington, President Bush said the U.S. troops have accomplished ``a real turnaround'' in restoring law and order in Panama.
